definitions.definition: A band, flange , ferrule , or collar , designed to grip and hold a tool or a workpiece under proper control, and usually to release it under control thereafter; such a collet usually is made of a hard, springy material, especially a metal.
examples: That collet can handle up to 3/8-inch bits.

definitions.definition: ( jewelry ) The rim (of a ring ) within which a jewel is set .
examples: There is an almost invisible collet that secures the stone to the ring.

definitions.definition: ( horticulture ) In an embryonic plant, the transition zone between the root and the hypocotyl (not clearly distinguishable in most plants.)
examples: Collar rot forms in the collet between the stem and the root.

main_definition: A band, flange , ferrule , or collar , designed to grip and hold a tool or a workpiece under proper control, and usually to release it under control thereafter; such a collet usually is made of a hard, springy material, especially a metal.
secondary_definitions: ( jewelry ) The rim (of a ring ) within which a jewel is set .
( horticulture ) In an embryonic plant, the transition zone between the root and the hypocotyl (not clearly distinguishable in most plants.)

definitions.definition: Alternative form of colet ( “ lower servant in a church ” ) .

main_definition: Alternative form of colet ( “ lower servant in a church ” ) .
